alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Harrison; Nicholas (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:34AM EDT until July 28 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Bourbon County in central Kentucky... Eastern Harrison KY County in central Kentucky... Northwestern Nicholas County in central Kentucky... * Until 545 AM EDT. * At 334 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported that flood waters are in the process of receding. Significant flash flooding earlier did close numerous roads and threaten homes. Road closures included Oddville Ave/US 62 East in Cynthiana. Some evacuations occurred in Cynthiana. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cynthiana, Millersburg, Venus, Colville, Buena Vista, Oddville, Morning Glory, Hooktown, Barefoot and Poindexter. This includes the following streams and drainages... Hooktown Branch, Indian Creek, Crooked Creek, Mill Creek, Stony Creek, Sycamore Creek, Hinkston Creek, Rankin Branch, Laysons Branch, Silas Creek, Grays Run, Stoner Creek, Paddys Run, Edgewater Branch, Little Beaver Creek, Brushy Fork, Brushy Creek, West Branch Sugar Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely and have them relay your report to the National Weather Service in Louisville.
